page.title: 01THE IRON AGE HILL FORT
page.content: Although arrow heads and flint scrapers dating back to 3500BC had been found in the area,there is no concrete evidence pointing to a significant settlement in the vicinity of Hagley before the{Iron Age.}The local fort on{Wychbury Hill}was probably constructed by the{Iron Age 'B' peoples,who first penetrated the Bristol Channel in approximately 150 BC. Of the two tribes occupying the Severn Valley in this period, it is most likely that the{Cornovii}lived at {Wychbury.}Although the western edge of Hagley is skirted by a{Roman road linking Droitwich to Greensforge,the sophisticated{Cornovii}social system would have remained virtually intact until the late 6th and early 7th century Saxon invasions.
